## useController() function

Custom hook to work with controlled component, this function provide you with both form and field level state. Re-render is isolated at the hook level.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function useController<TFieldValues extends FieldValues = FieldValues, TName extends FieldPath<TFieldValues> = FieldPath<TFieldValues>>(props: UseControllerProps<TFieldValues, TName>): UseControllerReturn<TFieldValues, TName>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  props | [UseControllerProps](./react-hook-form.usecontrollerprops.md)<!-- -->&lt;TFieldValues, TName&gt; | the path name to the form field value, and validation rules. |

**Returns:**

[UseControllerReturn](./react-hook-form.usecontrollerreturn.md)<!-- -->&lt;TFieldValues, TName&gt;

field properties, field and form state. [UseControllerReturn](./react-hook-form.usecontrollerreturn.md)

## Remarks

\[API\](https://react-hook-form.com/docs/usecontroller) â€¢ \[Demo\](https://codesandbox.io/s/usecontroller-0o8px)

## Example


```tsx
function Input(props) {
  const { field, fieldState, formState } = useController(props);
  return (
    <div>
      <input {...field} placeholder={props.name} />
      <p>{fieldState.isTouched && "Touched"}</p>
      <p>{formState.isSubmitted ? "submitted" : ""}</p>
    </div>
  );
}
```
